description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the kernel streaming service driver elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-38241), the following updates are recommended:

1. Identify your Windows version based on the build number and corresponding KB article.
2. Download and apply the necessary update package from the official Microsoft Update Catalog for your specific version:
   - Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5043067](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043067)
   - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: [KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)
   - Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems: [KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
   - Additional updates for Windows 10 Version 22H2 and 21H2 for 32-bit systems are also available.
3. Restart your system after applying the updates to ensure changes are effective.

**Details**:
- This fix mitigates a significant elevation of privilege vulnerability that could potentially be exploited by attackers.
- Make sure to apply the updates corresponding to your Windows build number. Backup important data before proceeding with the update installation.
